text: <extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a cell-surface receptor that can augment lymphocyte activation and survival through its ability to induce the transcription factor NF-kappaB .
<extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , however , has also been implicated in the induction of apoptotic cell death of lymphocytes .

Here we show that one of the effects of <extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signal transduction is to render cells sensitive to apoptosis induced by the <extra_id_0> type 1 tumor necrosis factor receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TNFR1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .
This sensitization is dependent on the TRAF-binding sites within the <extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cytoplasmic domain .

One of the proteins that binds to these sites is <extra_id_0> TRAF2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a signal transduction molecule that is also utilized by <extra_id_0> TNFR1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to mediate the activation of several downstream kinases and transcription factors .

During <extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signal transduction , we found that binding of <extra_id_0> TRAF2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to the cytoplasmic domain of <extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> results in the rapid depletion of <extra_id_0> TRAF2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the associated protein <extra_id_0> TRAF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by proteolysis .

text: These data suggest a model in which <extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> limits its own ability to transduce cell survival signals through signal-coupled depletion of <extra_id_0> TRAF2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Depletion of intracellular <extra_id_0> TRAF2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and its coassociated proteins also increased the sensitivity of the cell to undergoing apoptosis during activation of death - inducing receptors such as <extra_id_0> TNFR1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Consistent with this hypothesis , expression of a dominant - negative form of <extra_id_0> TRAF2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was found to potentiate <extra_id_0> TNFR1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated death .

These studies provide a potential mechanism through which <extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , as well as other TRAF - binding members of the TNFR superfamily , can negatively regulate cell survival .
